unnormalised: The Ministry of Education announced a new unique ID system for students across India, effective 01/01/2025. Every student from Class 1 onward will be assigned a "Vidya ID," a 12-digit alphanumeric code, to track their academic progress throughout their schooling years. Officials stated the aim is to streamline data management and reduce redundancy, replacing existing registration numbers from different boards like CBSE and ICSE. The ID will also be linked to their Aadhaar no. for verification purposes.
normalised: The Ministry of Education announced a new unique I-D system for students across India, effective first January two thousand and twenty five. Every student from Class one onward will be assigned a "Vidya I-D", a twelve-digit alphanumeric code, to track their academic progress throughout their schooling years. Officials stated the aim is to streamline data management and reduce redundancy, replacing existing registration numbers from different boards like C-B-S-E and I-C-S-E. The I-D will also be linked to their Aadhaar number for verification purposes.

unnormalised: This move has been met with mixed reactions. Some educators have welcomed the initiative, seeing it as a step towards modernizing the education system. Ms. Sharma, a principal at a Delhi school, said, "This Vidya ID will help us easily access student records and reduce paperwork." However, concerns have been raised about data privacy and security, particularly regarding the linking of Vidya ID with Aadhaar card details. Concerns arose mostly regarding security of student IDs and personal information.

unnormalised: The Vidya ID, as per the notification ref. no. EDU/2024/11/15, will also be used for employment purposes later on. Employers can use the "Seek ID", a linked derivative of the Vidya ID generated post-graduation, to verify a candidate's educational background. This is meant to simplify the job application process and prevent fraudulent claims regarding qualifications. The Ministry assures that stringent data protection measures are in place, compliant with the IT Act, 2000.
